It just won't go up anymore." jagdeep_m2000 on November 10, 2009: "If Cramer called it a BUY..then SELL hand over fist...he is ALWAYS wrong. Just do the opposite. Thanks Cramer." jagdeep_m2000 on November 10, 2009: "More certain about the fall...the higher you go..the longer you have to fall...and don't pretend..you know it too...even though Its hard for me to believe that individuals own AMZN...it has to be MMs at this price..coz individuals can't be that ignorant or stupid." jagdeep_m2000 on November 10, 2009: "I am also short 400 shares :(..and honestly..DO NOT cover. The same thing happened to me with GS..I was short at 170 and I covered it too soon. Topic.Title: AMZN: the greatest stock in the Universe.

Message.Msg: There is no way they can cough up more hmm "earnings" in this business environment. Consumers are spending using a lot of debt. When they cut back, price, no matter how low will entice them to buy. The best case they can hope for is hovering around this ridiculous price and not much else. Everything is on borrowed time. Some will defer longer than others but they all have to pay in the end.

Message.Title: 10% correction in general markets coming next
Message.Msg: . Why ? Simple , retail investor needs and wants to be in the game . Now looking at the markets and stocks , the investor sees stocks at high levels , not to mention that the markets have been up up and away as of the last 7 months . What to do ? Have a healthy pullback of say 7% to 10 % at which point , people will be told , see now is the time to buy , we are in a bull market territory and you must take advantage of this pullback in prices. Thus , what better reason to have a pullback . It is time for a healthy pullback . Amzn will be a play in this pullback to say $225 level to $195 in a extreme pullback and then back up again . same with goog , aapl , nflx , pcln . This being said , place your bets. GL

Message.Title: Barron's article
Message.Msg: So does it surprise anybody that AMZN is seen as a leading offender of not recognizing the expense of offering restricted stock to employees? This simple omission causes net income to be more than double what it would be if GAAP were indeed followed. according to the newest Barron's. Will any of the big holders care? They probably already know. but now the rest of us do also. The best part is that it makes an already paltry p/e look downright anemic.

"offering restricted stock to employees" One of many basic problemz with executive compensation in american publically traded companiez. One of many wayz 401k, pension and sheeple baggie etfs and retail brokerage accounts are systemically stripped of 'ownership equity' az wealth iz transfered fron the many to the few. Its been going on for 35 yearz and haz gone parabolic in the last 25 - every more and more free and dilutive stock comp in order to 'attract and retain' the brightest of knuckleheaded ceo's, board memberz, and executivez. You can read the mission objective verbatum without much variance in every Board Finànce Comittie'z annual report for their select publically traded scam. WAKE THE FVCK UP, SHEEPLE YOUR IN THE MATRIX. THEZE EXECS ARE NO SMARTER OR BETTER THAN YOUR AVERAGE RETREAD. IF THEY WERE THEY WOULD NOT HAVE TO STRIP THE PUBLIC OF EQUITY THROUGH A BUSINESS, THEY WOULD KEEP IT PRIVATE FOR THEMSELVES. Did allen mullaly create ford? No. Did jimmy dimond create JPM? no. How about pandit with bac? No. Iz bezos, the founder of amazn making any money in the business? no - so whats the solution to make money ? Go public with stox. ITS A SCAM, PEOPLE THE WHOLE THING IZ A FVCK IN WEALTH STRIPPING SCAM TO TRANFER WEALTH FROM THE SHEEPLE MANY TO THE CONNECTED AND FORTUNATE FEW.
Actually pandit was citi banks privilaged hack, not bank of america's.
